Preterit.text: 1-Mḥeli i= kefo, ḥakimo b-riše du Laḥdo (İlyac p.c)
2-Hawli kefe mә šәkәl d ḥakәm. (İlyac p.c)

Ṭabi hano kowe li=čmənto, lu=šyoʕo dab=bote, lu=bnoyo-we. Xulṭiwayle bu=kalšo aw bi=čmanto du=waxtawo. Kəmminale kalšo. Ánnaqqa gmaxlanwa saṭlo m-awo ʕal u=ṭino, čmənto yani kalšo, w kefo aʕle, kefe mə šǝkəl d-ḥakəm. Kefe nqiwe, šriqe, məqqa d-howən... hawxa d-lowən ġalabe šafire w msawye ṭawtər-ne, laǧan d-zəbṭi ḥḏoḏe, d-məsnodi ləḥḏoḏe, ʕam i=čmənto. Naturally, this (=ʕafro) is needed for the cement, it was for smoothing the houses, for building. They mixed it with lime, or with cement of that time.We call it lime. Now then, they emptied a bucket of that stuff (qalšo) upon the clay, cement that is lime, and a stone upon it (kalšo), stones of whatever kind that chanced (to come to hand). Stones full of holes, pitted stones, however much they are ...,  like so, if they are not very beautiful and even/smooth, they are better, so that they catch each other, are supported by each other, with the (help of) cement. 2019_13_01_Malfono_Ishaq;53

idioms: To get (to, into), to hit  2-to accur, to come into sight, to happen to be, to chance
